result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Ugo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation/extended supervision now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

judgments.dispoDesc: SENTENCE VACATED AS A RESULT OF DEFENDANT REVOKING PROBATION.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael A Ugo

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  No victim notification needed.  Victim has never replied to DA's office.  Defendant was given a copy of DOC's 12/15 letter and he read it in court.  Court explained he has a right to counsel.  He wishes to proceed without counsel.  Court questioned his understanding of a waiver of right to attorney.  He understands and will proceed without counsel.  Court found that the defendant waived his right to attorney intelligently and knowingly.  State recommended:  45 days jail.  Credit for 24 days.  Defendant questioned the OWI custody January 8-12 in the DOC letter.  Court ordered:  30 days jail.  Find time served.
from DOC regarding defendant's rejection of probation
Hearing on December 16, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
DV court.  He is rejecting probation.  Hearing will be set for Friday.   Court advised the defendant of his attorney rights.
DV Court Sanction (faxed to PP & JASO)
DV court.  Defendant FTA.  3 day sanction ordered.  Starts when he is apprehended.  Probation will issue an apprehension request.
DV Court Sanction (faxed to PP & JASO)

DV Court - he is to call B.G. today.  Discussed employment situation.  Will have more information today.  He is to contact TM after he hears back.  3-day sanction ordered which can be served over the weekend due to violation.  If job not starting right away will start sanction right away.

Recorded by FTR.  DV court.  He talked to Agent T.M. about the expectations of DV court.  He understands.  Contact Agent by the end of Wednesday this week.   He is laid off until the middle of November.  Has been doing some side work.  Had a job offer, accepted it yesterday.  He will start on Monday.  Community service work explained.  He understood.
DV court.  First hearing.  Court advised the defendant of the expectations for DV court.  He understood.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Dismiss but read in Count 1.  Plead guilty to Count 2.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation with conditions.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he plead to.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the plea, consitutional rights waived.  Court finds plea entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Defense stipulates as to a factual basis for the plea.  Court finds a factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.   Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  CC.  Domestic abuse assessment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.
